ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: It is the one who hates you who is cut off without an heir.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: It is surely your opponents whose line will come to end.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Verily your enemy alone has been cut off from the roots.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Whoever hates you will himself remain childless.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Indeed it is your enemy who is bereft of all goodness.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: For he who hates you, he will be cut off.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Surely your enemy is the one who shall be without posterity,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Surely he that hates thee, he is the one cut off.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Lo! it is thy insulter (and not thou) who is without posterity.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: It is the one who hates you who has been cut off.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Verily it is thy traducer who shall be tail-less.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Indeed it is your enemy who is without posterity.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: For he who hateth thee, he will be cut off (from Future Hope).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: For he who makes you angry (O Muhammad (Peace be upon him)), - he will be cut off (from every good thing in this world and in the Hereafter).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Surely, he who hates you, he is the most severed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: He who hates you is the loser.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Indeed, your enemy is the one cut off.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [108:3] Indeed it is your antagonist, your hater, who is the severed one, refraining from all [acts of] good, or the one whose line of offspring will be severed [by his not having any]: this was revealed regarding al-‘Āsī b. Wā’il, who called the Prophet (s) al-abtar, ‘the severed one’, when his son al-Qāsim died. Meccan or Medinese, consisting of 6 verses; this was revealed when a band of idolaters said to the Prophet (s), ‘What if you worship our gods for one year, and we worship your God the next?’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Lo! It is thy insulter) the one who despises you ((and not thou) who is without posterity) he will be without family, children, wealth or any goodness; he will not be mentioned after his death, i.e. al-'As Ibn Wa'il al- Sahmi, while you will be mentioned with every good. This is because, when his son 'Abdullah died, they said: "Muhammad (pbuh) is without posterity".'
